column2: Breathing heavily before being brought up. Died after being brought into lab. Had two small tumors, one by right foreleg and one under left ear. Had undergone rigor mortis upon necropsy.
DCT-TVA; Braf CA; ink/arf f/f; pten f/f
Brain, lungs, heart, liver, kidneys, spleen, tumor
Brain was soft but not quite mush, so it came out in one piece.
H&L were heavily encapsulated/invaded by possible metastases. It was hard to distinguish between tumor and normal tissue, and it all came out in pieces due to degradation of tissue.
No tumor chunks frozen or cell line attempted.
